flawed_nl_solution:
Twice Jill's age is 2*20=<<2*20=40>>40
If Roger's age is 5 more than twice Jill's age, he is 5+40=45 years old.
In 15 years, Jill will be 20+15=<<20+15=35>>35 years old.
Roger's age will be 45+15=<<45+15=60>>60 years old in 15 years.
The age difference between Roger and Jill in fifteen years will be 60-35=<<60-35=52>>52 years
In 15 years, the age difference between Roger and Jill will be 30 years less than Finley's age, meaning in fifteen years Finley will be 30+52=<<30+52=82>>82 years old.
Currently, Finley is 82-15=<<82-15=67>>67 years old.
#### 67

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 25, not 52. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
